problem.p: Suppose there were a planet with exactly the same density as earth, but with a radius half as great as the Earth's radius. The mass of a uniform sphere is given by \(M=(4/3)\pi\)\(r^3\)\(\rho\), where \(\rho\) is the density of the sphere. What would be the ratio of \(g_p/g_E\) for the gravity on this planet compared to gravity on earth? Note that the mass of the planet would be 8 times smaller than earth.
